page.title: 14MEDIA
page.content: { Newspapers} The Vale of Clwyd produces its own newspaper"The Denbighshire Free Press" and reports on items of interest connected with the surounding towns and villages.In June 1981, it celebrated it's 100th anniversary and produced a souvenir edition containing scores of photographs and articles. "Y Bedol" is a Welsh language paper produced monthly.It is run by a committee of volunteers and is of a very high standard.The "Liverpool Daily Post" is widely read as is the regionally distributed paper "Y Cymro" {Radio/T.V. The Moel y Parc transmitter overlooks the Vale and S4C,BBC1 / 2 and HTV are clearly received. Radio Cymru is the most popular radio station amongst the Welsh speakers of the region.
